remixlab.dandelion.branch

Class WheeledMouseAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.core.Agent
      • remixlab.bias.branch.GenericAgent
        • remixlab.bias.branch.GenericMotionAgent
          • remixlab.dandelion.branch.MotionAgent<Constants.DOF2Action>
            • remixlab.dandelion.branch.WheeledMouseAgent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MouseAgent

    public abstract class WheeledMouseAgent
extends MotionAgent<Constants.DOF2Action>
    A MotionAgent<DOF2Action>, such as most mice, supporting Constants.ClickActions, and up to Constants.DOF2Actions actions.

    See Also:
    Constants.ClickAction, Constants.DOF1Action, Constants.DOF2Action

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class remixlab.bias.branch.GenericMotionAgent

        GenericMotionAgent.PickingMode

        CENTER_ID, DOWN_KEY, LEFT_ID, LEFT_KEY, RIGHT_ID, RIGHT_KEY, UP_KEY, WHEEL_ID

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WheeledMouseAgent(GenericScene scn, String n)
      Creates a mouse agent and appends the MotionAgent.eyeBranch() and MotionAgent.frameBranch() to it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WheeledMouseAgent

        public WheeledMouseAgent(GenericScene scn,
                         String n)
        Creates a mouse agent and appends the MotionAgent.eyeBranch() and MotionAgent.frameBranch() to it. The mouse agent is added to the GrabberScene.inputHandler().

    • Method Detail

      • sensitivities

        public float[] sensitivities(MotionEvent event)
        Description copied from class: Agent
        Returns the sensitivities used in Agent.handle(BogusEvent) to MotionEvent.modulate(float[]).
        Overrides:
        sensitivities in class MotionAgent<Constants.DOF2Action>

      • setXSensitivity

        public void setXSensitivity(float sensitivity)
        Defines the xSensitivity().

      • xSensitivity

        public float xSensitivity()
        Returns the x sensitivity.

        Default value is 1. A higher value will make the event more efficient (usually meaning a faster motion). Use a negative value to invert the along x-Axis motion direction.

        See Also:
        MotionAgent.setWheelSensitivity(float)

      • setYSensitivity

        public void setYSensitivity(float sensitivity)
        Defines the ySensitivity().

      • ySensitivity

        public float ySensitivity()
        Returns the y sensitivity.

        Default value is 1. A higher value will make the event more efficient (usually meaning a faster motion). Use a negative value to invert the along y-Axis motion direction.

        See Also:
        MotionAgent.setWheelSensitivity(float)

      • dragToArcball

        public void dragToArcball()
        Set mouse bindings as 'arcball'. Bindings are as follows:

        1. InteractiveFrame bindings
        Left button : ROTATE
        Center button : SCALE
        Right button : TRANSLATE
        Shift + Center button : SCREEN_TRANSLATE
        Shift + Right button : SCREEN_ROTATE

        2. InteractiveFrame bindings
        Left button : ROTATE
        Center button : ZOOM
        Right button : TRANSLATE
        Shift + Left button : ZOOM_ON_REGION
        Shift + Center button : SCREEN_TRANSLATE
        Shift + Right button : SCREEN_ROTATE.

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        See Also:
        dragToFirstPerson(), dragToThirdPerson()

      • moveToArcball

        public void moveToArcball()
        Set mouse bindings as 'arcball'. Bindings are as follows:

        1. InteractiveFrame bindings
        No-button : ROTATE
        Shift + No-button : SCALE
        Ctrl + No-button : TRANSLATE
        Center button : SCREEN_TRANSLATE
        Right button : SCREEN_ROTATE

        2. InteractiveFrame bindings
        No-button : ROTATE
        Shift + No-button : ZOOM
        Ctrl + No-button : TRANSLATE
        Ctrl + Shift + No-button : ZOOM_ON_REGION
        Center button : SCREEN_TRANSLATE
        Right button : SCREEN_ROTATE.

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        Note that Alt + No-button is bound to the null action.

        See Also:
        dragToFirstPerson(), dragToThirdPerson()

      • dragToFirstPerson

        public void dragToFirstPerson()
        Set mouse bindings as 'first-person'. Bindings are as follows:

        1. InteractiveFrame bindings
        Left button : ROTATE
        Center button : SCALE
        Right button : TRANSLATE
        Shift + Center button : SCREEN_TRANSLATE
        Shift + Right button : SCREEN_ROTATE

        2. InteractiveFrame bindings
        Left button : MOVE_FORWARD
        Center button : LOOK_AROUND
        Right button : MOVE_BACKWARD
        Shift + Left button : ROTATE_Z
        Shift + Center button : DRIVE
        Ctrl + Wheel : ROLL
        Shift + Wheel : DRIVE

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        See Also:
        dragToArcball(), dragToThirdPerson()

      • moveToFirstPerson

        public void moveToFirstPerson()
        Set mouse bindings as 'first-person'. Bindings are as follows:

        1. InteractiveFrame bindings
        No-button : ROTATE
        Shift + No-button : SCALE
        Ctrl + No-button : TRANSLATE
        Center button : SCREEN_TRANSLATE
        Right button : SCREEN_ROTATE

        2. InteractiveFrame bindings
        Ctrl + No-button : MOVE_FORWARD
        No-button : LOOK_AROUND
        Shift + No-button : MOVE_BACKWARD
        Right button : ROTATE_Z
        Ctrl + Shift + No-button : DRIVE
        Ctrl + Shift + Wheel : ROTATE_Z
        Shift + Wheel : DRIVE

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        Note that Alt + No-button is bound to the null action.

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        See Also:
        dragToArcball(), dragToThirdPerson()

      • dragToThirdPerson

        public void dragToThirdPerson()
        Set mouse bindings as 'third-person'. Bindings are as follows: *

        Left button : MOVE_FORWARD
        Center button : LOOK_AROUND
        Right button : MOVE_BACKWARD
        Shift + Left button : ROLL
        Shift + Center button : DRIVE

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        See Also:
        dragToArcball(), dragToFirstPerson()

      • moveToThirdPerson

        public void moveToThirdPerson()
        Set mouse bindings as 'third-person'. Bindings are as follows:

        Ctrl + No-button : MOVE_FORWARD
        No-button : LOOK_AROUND
        Shift + No-button : MOVE_BACKWARD
        Ctrl + Shift + Wheel : ROTATE_Z
        Ctrl + Shift + No-button : DRIVE

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        Note that Alt + No-button is bound to the null action.

        Also set the following (common) bindings are:

        2 left clicks : ALIGN_FRAME
        2right clicks : CENTER_FRAME
        Wheel in 2D : SCALE both, InteractiveFrame and InteractiveFrame
        Wheel in 3D : SCALE InteractiveFrame, and ZOOM InteractiveFrame

        See Also:
        dragToArcball(), dragToFirstPerson()

        Same as return hasBinding(target, new ClickShortcut(button, ncs)).
        See Also:
        #hasBinding(Target, ClickShortcut)
